etymology.description: Originally a pictogram: a cross-shaped measuring compass. Later reformulated as 夫 (“husband”) + 見 (“see”) (traditionally ideogrammic); Smith (2011) suggests the left abbreviates phonetic 癸, while Chen (2021) links the left to 矩.
etymology.interpretation: Earliest forms sketched a measuring compass directly, then later scribes reanalyzed it as 夫 + 見 to evoke observing or measuring by a rule. Some scholars see a phonetic echo of 癸 on the left, and others align its semantics with tool characters like 矩.
etymology.simplification: Mainly replaced 見 with 见 as a regular component simplification; the left 夫 was retained.

examples.chinese: 遵守交通规则(遵守交通規則)。
工匠用圆规画圆(工匠用圓規畫圓)。
examples.english: The craftsman uses a compass to draw a circle.

examples.chinese: 做事要有规矩(做事要有規矩)。
examples.english: One should follow rules when doing things.
